qas.question: What are likely to be paraphyletic?
Strepsiptera and Diptera are controversial what?
Strepsiptera and Diptera grouped together are called what?
A discussion regarding wing pairs is not supported by what community?
What is split or lumped together by a taxonomist?

context: <a0_0>The Exopterygota<a0_0/> likely are paraphyletic in regard to the Endopterygota. <a1_0>Matters<a1_0/> that have incurred controversy include Strepsiptera and Diptera grouped together as <a2_0>Halteria<a2_0/> based on a reduction of one of the wing pairs – a position not well-supported in <a3_0>the entomological community<a3_0/>. <a4_0>The Neuropterida<a4_0/> are often lumped or split on the whims of the taxonomist. Fleas are now thought to be closely related to boreid mecopterans. Many questions remain in the basal relationships amongst endopterygote orders, particularly the Hymenoptera.
